description: A bash script that reads the last line from a log file every 10 seconds and displays it.

features.name: Read Last Log Entry
features.description: Reads and displays the most recent timestamp from '../log.txt' every 10 seconds.

features.name: File Locking
features.description: Uses file locking to safely read from the log file only when it is not locked by the writer.

features.name: Graceful Handling
features.description: Displays notification if '../log.txt' does not exist yet.

operating_environment: Unix-like shell with bash and flock
output: Displays the last line of '../log.txt' to the console
